document.masterDocTitle: Two new records and some additional notes on Elateridae (Coleoptera) fauna of Turkey

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new records and some additional notes on Elateridae (Coleoptera) fauna of Turkey

subSubSection.paragraph: M a t e r i a l e x a m i n e d: Kahramanmaraş : Nurhak Mountain, 22.VII.1984 , 44 exs. , totally 44 specimens .

D i s t r i b u t i o n i n T u r k e y Turkey (LÖBL & SMETANA 2007; MERTLIK & PLATIA 2008); Western Anatolia , Denizli (Babadağ) ( SAHLBERG 1912 -1913); Karaman , Mersin (Tarsus) [as
Synaptus filiformis erivanus
FALDERMANN, 1835] ( SAHLBERG 1912 - 1913); Western Anatolia [as
Synaptus filiformis levantinus
SAHLBERG, 1913] ( SAHLBERG 1912 -1913); Anatolia [as
Synaptus filiformis levantinus
SAHLBERG, 1913] ( SCHENKLING 1925 -1927); Marmara and Thrace Regions, Kocaeli ( Izmit ), Osmaniye , Sakarya (Akyazı) ( SEKENDIZ 1974 ); Çanakkale (Küçükkuyu), Kastamonu (Central province, Ilgaz Mountain Pass), Malatya (Eskimalatya), Samsun (Bafra), Zonguldak ( Karabük ) (GUGLIELMI & PLATIA 1985); Çanakkale (Küçükkuyu), Kastamonu (Central province, Ilgaz Mountain Pass), Malatya (Eskimalatya), Samsun (Bafra), Zonguldak ( Karabük ) [as
Synaptus filiformis levantinus
SAHLBERG, 1913] (GUGLIELMI & PLATIA 1985); Ankara (Akyurt, Ayaş, Beypazarı, Elmadağ, Kızılcahamam, Nallıhan) (KABALAK & SERT 2005); Ankara (Central province, Hacıkadın, Mamak, Nallıhan, Yenimahalle), Antalya (Gazipaşa), Ardahan , Artvin [Şavşat (Yavuzköy), Yusufeli (Altıparmak Mountain), Sarıgöl], Aydın (Çine), Bingöl [Solhan (Yenibaşak)], Erzurum (Narman, Oltu, Pasinler, Şenkaya (Turnalı), Tortum, Alapınar, Uzundere], Eskişehir [Bozan (Beylikhisar)], Hatay (Erzin), Kars [Sarıkamış (Karakurt)], Konya [Beyşehir (Gökçimen)], Kütahya ( KESDEK et al. 2006 ); Izmir [Bornova (Central province, Pınarbaşı, Zeytinköy), Ödemiş (Central province, Bozdağ)] ( GULPERCIN & TEZCAN 2009 ); Aksaray (Central province, Güzelyurt), Ankara (Ayaş, Beypazarı, Elmadağ), Çankırı (Şabanözü), Eskişehir (Central province, Mihalgazi, Mihalıççık, Sarıcakaya), Karaman (Central province, Başyayla, Ermenek), Kayseri (Central province, Develi, Felahiye, Incesu, Özvatan, Sarıoğlan, Sarız, Yahyalı, Yeşilhisar), Kırşehir (Central province, Akpınar, Kaman), Konya (Akören, Akşehir, Derebucak, Hadim, Ilgın, Sarayönü, Seydişehir, Yunak), Nevşehir (Acıgöl, Ürgüp), Niğde (Central province, Çamardı, Ulukışla), Sivas (Central province, Divriği, Doğanşar, Gemerek, Gürün, Hafik, Imranlı, Koyulhisar, Suşehri, Şarkışla, Yıldızeli, Zara), Yozgat (Central province, Akdağmadeni, Çandır, Çayıralan, Sarıkaya, Yerköy) (KABALAK & SERT 2011). Adana (Tufanbeyli), Afyonkarahisar (Anıtkaya, Sincanlı), Ankara (Central province), Antalya (Manavgat), Artvin (Central province), Balıkesir (Kepsut, Manyas, Susurluk), Bartın (Central province, Ulus), Bilecik (Central province, Bozöyük, Gölpazarı), Bitlis [Mutki Road ( 10 km )], Bolu (Mengen), Bursa (Central province), Çanakkale (Gökçeada), Denizli (Honaz), Düzce (Akçakoca), Edirne (Lalapaşa), Gaziantep (Central province), Gümüşhane (Mertekli), Izmir (Bornova, Kemalpaşa-Çambel, Menemen, Ödemiş, Ödemiş- Bozdağ, Ödemiş- Bozdağ- Büyük Çavdar, Zeytinköy), Kahramanmaraş (Afşin, Andırın, Göksun), Karabük (Central province), Kastamonu (Tosya), Kayseri (Pınarbaşı), Kırklareli (Central province, Ikizdere, Pınarhisar), Kırşehir (Kaman), Konya (Akşehir, Ereğli), Kütahya (Central province, Domaniç, Örencik, Tavşanlı-Tepecik), Manisa (Demirci, Ömerli), Mardin (Bozhöyük), Muğla (Dalaman), Rize (Ardeşen), Sakarya (Taraklı), Şırnak (İdil- Peçenek), Tekirdağ (Central province, Barbaros), Tokat (Central province), Uşak (Central province), Zonguldak (Çaycuma) (GULPERCIN & TEZCAN 2012b). Distributional map of
S. filiformis
in Turkey is given on Fig. 23.

In consequence of this study, it has been observed that a total of 132 specimens of 23 species belonging to 12 genera of Elateridae ( Coleoptera ) have been reported from the collection of Lodos Entomological Museum, Turkey (LEMT). Among these
Adrastus temperei LESEIGNEUR, 1974
and
Ampedus lenkoranus (REITTER, 1889)
are first records for Turkish Elateridae fauna.
